result.execSummary:
The defendant George Diver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Complete SAFE program intake and any recommended counseling.  

COURT COSTS REMITTED.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. George Diver

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Britney
Case Called: 2:32 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner. Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Paul Goetz. Date & time set for Final Pre-trial. Parties have reached an agreement and proceed with Plea Hearing. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights and Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed. VRCW. 
State moves to DRI Ct.1- Battery (Domestic Abuse) 
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: Ct.2- Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse)>>GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding. 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH- 1 year probation. CONDITIONS: Complete SAFE program intake and any recommended counseling, AODA, maintain absolute sobriety & all CC are remitted. 
Defendant is entitled to 37 days credit if revoked. 
Adj: 2:47 p.m.

Pre-trial conference on June 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Final pre-trial on June 26, 2015 at 02:20 pm.
Jury Trial on July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No contact with victim(s):  C.J.W. (non-waivable).  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.    Shall not consume alcohol.  Absolute sobriety.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.
